did.unittitle: Songs and Dances of the Rural Ottawa and Chippewa Indians

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Gertrude Kurath. This material was recorded with the assistance of a Phillips Fund grant.

did.unittitle: Longfellow's Use of Michigan Indian Tales

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Recording of a talk given at a symposium titled "Michigan Indian Lore since 'Hiawatha'," held by the Michigan Folklore Society, of which Gertrude P. Kurath was Chairman.

scopecontent.p: Hymn sung in Chippewa with some English responses from congregation. Recorded at Chippewa Free Methodist Camp Meeting Revival Service. English title of hymn: "O for a thousand tongues"
